name: chubbied
text: Comment left by chubbied ignored.

name: ifergott
text:
fuck you and fuck what you've done.

A cat is about to DIE and that is how you pay your respects?

name: ifergott
text: At least the pillow Roast Beef is lying on in the last panel is happy.

name: greyfield
text: And in the previous two panels it's trying to eat him.

name: sweetlips
text: That pillow does seem way, way turned on. I guess it figures a soon-to-be-dead guy wont be able to go to the police...

name: jeffspaulding
text:
Have you heard the one about the corduroy pillow?

It's making headlines.

name: stonecrab
text: I swear, if you are not my brother, Greg, I will eat my Yurdish Dying Hat.

name: jeffspaulding
text:
Sorry, although I am brother to four, I can give you no quarter.

Doubly sorry that the pillow joke is a Bloom County reference.

name: stonecrab
text: Damn - I accidently lamed you!! So sorry! I meant to hit "reply". Oh well, I knew it was from Bloom County (who could forget Milo waking his father to tell him that joke?) Damn, you and my brother are just so much alike you could be... related !

name: jeffspaulding
text: I'm sure I deserved a lame for something I did.  Karmic justice will be satisfied.

name: carlyle
text:
Milo? I haven't read them for a while but the only person with a dad was Binkley, but I might have missed mention of any others.

...Unless you're talking about Milo's grandfather?

name: stonecrab
text: Dang, Carlyle, thanks for pointing that out!  Of course I meant Binkley! (Must have been "sort of stoned" at the time...)  :)

name: biznart
text: That crack really made an impression on me.

name: belgand
text:
Florida did have a crippling addiction to crack, but it didn't come up on the show all that often.

Kinda racist to mention a black woman's crack problem biznart.

name: spazdor
text:
That's what she said!

About my ass.

name: spazdor
text: Come to think of it, I'm really not sure what she was getting at.

name: carlyle
text: And in the last it's smiling! What the hell?

name: westsider8
text: That's because RB's slide to the right has provided him with a better view of the mystery person in seat z-1.

name: goneill451
text: It's looking dire.  Smuck's melon is twained, RB is resigned, and CH moves with swift, elegant certainty.  Please, cartoon monster, please don't kill this cartoon cat.

name: gormster
text:
now hang on a second. Paper does not do that when you pour vinegar on it... or does it?

BRB Assetbarbarians, I'm doing science .

name: octafish
text: That paper is ever so slightly alkali.

name: gormster
text:
The results are in:

The paper does slowly form bubbles - I'm not sure the reaction going on here, but I suspect it is some equilibrium situation between the acetic acid and air - but the vinegar does not change colour.

What with the terminal velocity, gravity and now chemistry stuff ups, I'm starting to think there's something fishy going on here.

name: belgand
text:
Neither the paper nor the "vinegar" have been concretely established. Until that is done it is not feasible to properly replicate the experiment. We don't even know it this was performed at STP!

A proper scientist also needs to know the construction of the reaction vessels in case that might have affected the results.

name: expellens
text: Chubbs for rockin' the STP. You gots to do your science proppa .

name: gormster
text:
Well my house is about 1km from the sea, and roughly 55m above sea level, so I'm going to assume the AP was about 101.3 kPa. The temperature was roughly 20°C. The paper was standard Reflex White A4, and the amount used was 18 square centimetres. The vinegar was Cornwell's White, and the vessel used was an open glass container, properly cleaned.

I didn't post all that because it was boring.

name: lateadopter
text: To you, maybe.  I need to go home and change my pants.

name: belgand
text:
I meant for CH. We cannot properly replicate his results because we lack the necessary data.

Science chub.

name: hal
text:
Did you try with bleched or unbleached paper? Was it a closed or an open reaction? Did you pour the vinegar at a uniform rate?

I fie upon your ill-documented findings. I believe you would shoot a theory.

name: shelbydavis
text: I fie the findings as his father!

name: hal
text: ...D-Daddy?  You've been gone so long...why did you leave us?

name: belgand
text: For SCIENCE!

name: comrade_tom
text:
My Father, he leave me for SCIENCE too!

I'm Thinking maybe Ju and Me are amigos!

name: gormster
text: Who the hell uses unbleached paper for gods sake? It was paper I got out of my printer. I tried to replicate the experiment as done in the comic so it was all at once in an open container.

name: anticitizen
text: seriously, don't do that again.

name: woodenteeth
text: It's called the Ignore Function. It will save you Indignities.

name: anticitizen
text: Oh aye, but I try to use it sparingly.  There's only maybe one or two posters beyond the preloaded list I've added myself.

name: mensch
text: "preloaded" is a good list to be on.

name: jeffspaulding
text: The risk of being preloaded is if you accidentally zip-up to quick; you could end up going off half-cocked.

name: gormster
text: what

name: saulbellow
text:
He knew they would be wandering around Target after his death, but he never knew it would be ... this ... bad ...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aLNtEGvhrT0

name: anticitizen
text:
how does that video get 1,000,000 views?

how the hell does that warrant merchandise?!

IF ANY ONE NEEDS ME, I'LL BE IN THE ANGRY DOME.

name: spectre
text: I need one of those. Lately, I've been mostly in the doghouse. An angry dome would be a pleasant change.

name: happyidiot
text: that kid is pretty funny.  man I bet so many chicks and gay guys want to fuck him.  I bet even lesbian chicks want to fuck him.  self confidence is sexy

name: happyidiot
text: see what I did there...  I inserted a comment that is inappropriate according to mainstream gender role norms...

name: fineoakstructure
text: there's a fine line between self-confidence and being stupid, asinine cunt with self-confidence but no dignity.

name: happyidiot
text:
well you let me know when you find just where that line is won't you. ;-)

(link to a video of Dylan performing his song "Dignity"... Assetbar have mercy...)

name: ampkit5
text: A comment left by ampkit5 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by UncleRifle, nbgreene, 21echoes, daidai, cunty, HamScout, gladi8orrex, brianwaka, Overman, philophobe, edd36, ummagumma, flazisismuss, anticitizen, Courtland, jay_wish, AdroitCelerity, Sweetlips, DunkOil, MortisInvictus, Bobothebum, cmr, Troy_Convers, jaypage, logic, agentstinky, lateadopter, cailetshadow, Hexjumper, usversusthem, NotCool, smooveb, hardelicious, greyfield, colorlessness, icecube, kestral)

name: sweetlips
text: If that were true it still wouldn't be.

name: stonecrab
text: Everytime I see "ampkit", I read it as "armpit". What the hell is wrong with me?

name: comrade_tom
text: Accept Jesus christ as your personal lord and saviour and everyone here at the Lynchburg Old Time Gospel hour will be happy to tell you.

name: philophobe
text: Almost more than anything else in this arc, I am terrified of Roast Beef's Dying Hat.  Is it a moustache?  A paper sailboat?  A snail which cannot bear to witness the Sadness of life, and has thus retracted its eyes?

name: lateadopter
text:
Chubbied for being the first comment that wasn't a "fRisT poTs!"

Some people are being added to my ignore list this afternoon. Fuu-uck mee!

name: lateadopter
text:
Dude, I didn't even put chubbied on my ignore list, and he's being ignored. He made it to the Big Time all by himself, and he's only been around for since the last strip. That's a record for anyone who isn't AIU, isn't it?

Hey, choco, no offense.

name: anticitizen
text:
I saw that too but thought I might've simply clicked *ignore* by mistake.

Dang. Kid's climbing.

name: choco
text: what?  You realize I *am[/i] AIU, right?

name: lexsenthur
text: I long for the days when a man could sport a proper dying hat and not be thought a fool or a collector of obscure illustrated comics in the style of the Far East.

name: kharitonov
text:
I think it might be a riff on a kalpak. ( This thing. ) They're worn in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan.

The Kyrgyz people can get kind of weird about it.

It has mysteries that they feel when they wear it

name: lateadopter
text:
So somehow the boys save Beef's car loan, right?

I'm picturing that scene from Breaking Away , where the son offers a refund, and the father starts shouting, "Refund?! Refund?!" and has to take bed rest.

name: flaxplus
text: So THAT'S what that movie is called! Thank you.

name: expellens
text: I like it when my older patients tell me that they took a cold. Makes me feel all avuncular inside.

name: possums
text:
Who is the Cat / in the Yurdish Dying Hat?
that is Roast Beef

name: zaer
text: That's right crying eagle... that is roast beef... now rest your pretty little bald head and forget about all of this.

name: troy_convers
text: A comment left by troy_convers was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by possums, HonestTom, JonBob, edd36, ummagumma, gingerbreadman, MortisInvictus, lateadopter, skjames, icecube)

name: overman
text: Target does have great prices.

name: hamscout
text: ...and he had a full life.  Oooh, Michael Graves funereal wreaths are on sale...

name: philophobe
text: And Martha Stewart Living offers some delightfully tactful handkerchiefs which, when wetted with tears, break down into a rosemary-lemon potpourri which can then be placed in or near the casket.  Y'know, for the prevention of the Odors.  And of course, you might as well stock up on toilet paper while you're here.  Maybe a few batteries.  Hell, I'd better get a cart after all.

name: lateadopter
text: And an extra large condom to carry it all?

name: hyetal
text: Ain't Martha Stewart just Kmart, though?

name: emosexy
text: Who goes to Kmart anymore?

name: lynnym
text: Roast Beef, you has been dead before. Couple time, actually. Let's hope this one aint permanent on account of some strange CH voodoo...

name: karljw
text: According to the handbook , the hastening process (ingestion of vinegar and chopped paper) will cause the afflicted to be placed in the queue of Samsara for reincarnation.

name: clmalone84
text: Yes...to be reincarnated as an "unfortunate being".  However, I put it to you, what is more unfortunate than being Roast Beef?  Discuss.

name: aperson
text: He has been hugely fortunate, in his latter days.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: I don't think anyone who finds himself lying in a bed waiting waiting for a soft-skulled monster to help him off with his mortal coil, while his best friends is strapped upside down in the desert with cerebrospinal fluid pooling on the ceiling of his overpriced status car, can really call himself fortunate.

name: octafish
text: Well he isn't Showbiz.

name: doppelganger
text:
Then again, I always envied that peculiar white-trash obliviousness, wherein they think that they are where its at.

An existence unfettered by scruples, hygiene or an acute awareness of ones own mortality is appealing.

I think that meth can help me reach my desired state.

name: anticitizen
text:
This heaven can be yours, doppelganger. It exists, this Paradise Earth, and is otherly known as "North Carolina".

Where I lived for twenty years but did no meth.

name: doppelganger
text:
Quote:
did no meth


Is that why they kicked you out?

I was actually in NC this week -- You get some motherfuckin' harsh rain.

name: anticitizen
text:
Yeah dude, Hurricane Alley represent.

And yessir. I made the mistake of telling a friend in public that I didn't do meth. Dude cold turned into Donald Sutherland at the end of Invasion of the Body Snatchers and I had no choice but to flee.

name: randyleepublic
text: I guarantee that meth will help you reach your desired state.  You'll be as unaware as it is possible to be.  I know.

name: spectre
text: Don't forget the Tequiza. Showbiz needs meth AND Tequiza to get to his "happy place."

name: comrade_tom
text:
I miss Showbiz, and Vlad, and Liebot, and Pat, and Rod, and Phillipe.

I even miss Todd.

Which is saying something.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
I miss the Kennedys.

Fuck.

name: fineoakstructure
text: what's this hair doing in my dang nachos?

name: belgand
text: This is the worst episode of Romper Room ever.

name: harvestgold
text: I'd rather have my journey from this mortal coil hastened by the hand of Dixie.

name: comrade_tom
text:
Man there have been a fair few hamlet references today.

Nice.

name: jeffspaulding
text: Dixie? I thought her name was Ophelia.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
We'll disagree then.
It looks to me like a very noble dying, compared to burning to death helplessly strapped in said self-same overpriced status car, while ONSTAR gibbers some horribly irrelevant finding and tunes you in to Sirius XM RawDog Comedy to fritter away your last breathing moments on Earth.

name: wozzeck
text:
Is Roast Beef is going out like a Shakespearean king?

It's not over until the fat black mama says, "Fuck THIS guy!"

name: singtralala
text: mortal coil is the best phrase in the english language

name: jeffspaulding
text: I'm still partial to titties and beer.

name: troy_convers
text: And Zappa references. It is Zappa, right and not #wince# Rodney Carrington?

text:
FZ.

(who the fuck is Rodney Carrington?)

text:
SOON...

[IMGS OFF]

name: octafish
text: Oh Charlie Brown, sorry but ...you died, you are dead.

name: jeffspaulding
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: chico
text: Dat Charlie Brown - he always a cracks me up (in a juvenile manifestation of existential angst kinda way).

name: chico
text: yea, you too!

name: doppelganger
text: Where's Marcel Marceau when you need him.

name: belgand
text:
Père Lachaise

I'll use an accent if I want, Assetbar be damned!

name: spectre
text: Two rows diagonally to the upperer left of Morrison.

name: zeppo
text: Ha ha ha, you guys and your jokes.  But seriously...

name: anticitizen
text: I myself have often thought that Charles Shultz dutifully picked up where Jean-Paul Sartre left off.

name: choco
text: You mean Huis Clos?  Yeah that's what's so great about Achewood is that it isn't the same old characters stuck between the same 4 walls ad nauseum.  Certain comics tend to answer that riddle of what's beyond the edge of the infinite...  answer: not much...

name: deus
text: ...4 hours and only 21 chubbies WHATS WRONG WITH YOU PEOPLE!!

name: belgand
text: My general dislike of Peanuts.

name: jeffspaulding
text: How do you feel about cashews?

name: mensch
text: If I cashew eating a peanut, I'll fuckin' kill you.

name: jeffspaulding
text: I can clearly see you're nuts.

name: chico
text: Dats not a my fault - these shorts shrunk.

name: spectre
text: Watch out for Todd. Winter is coming and he's . . . collecting. (But he'll forget where he put them.)

name: puguglypress
text: I regret that I have but one chubby to give for hamscout's comment.

name: gothicdance
text: Roast Beef is already an unfortunate being. you have assuaged my fears

name: legaltenderness
text:
Beef reincarnation puts him in Ray's vacated dome?

I'm going, what?

name: comrade_tom
text: "Roast Beef, you has been dead before. Couple time, actually" would sound hillarious if read out in a Forrest-Whitaker-in-the-last-king-of-scotland kind of a way.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Not like this. Those were judged accidental death by dipshit or fuckwittery.
This is Cartilage Head Blue Plate Special Night.

name: thesoulbear
text: God, look at his fingers as he cuts the paper! I shriek with disgust every time I see them.

name: jack
text: I noticed that too. At first I thought it might be a boy scout-style precaution against cutting his own fingers, but then I realized that if he was worried about such things he wouldn't be cutting toward himself. Then I thought that maybe at the point of the perpendicular cut the paper takes on some special property that shouldn't be touched with the fingertips, but it seems his fingertips are involved in the next panel. I settled on the same conclusion you reached: Cartilage Head is quintessentially creepy and does things in strange ways that we are not to understand.

name: randombeing
text: Do you see that the pillow is smiling in the final panel? This Onstad - he is a clever one.

name: tessebatt
text: I wonder if Onstad knows where this is going or if he's just making it all up as he goes.

name: puguglypress
text: Which would you prefer, honestly?

name: camidumas
text: He does not.  He has said he makes it up during each panel.  Presumably he has a general idea of where it is going but this arc, more so than any other in the history of the strip, demonstrates how malleable his process is.

name: aperson
text: How would this arc have looked different, had it been meticulously planned to turn out exactly the same way?

name: desert_donkey
text: x2

name: westsider8
text: I believe Roast Beef's depression has given him an inaccurate view about how his wife will receive news of his death.

name: aelindil
text: Wives generally aren't in favor of it, no.

name: noooo_oo_oo
text: Nowadays, I wouldn't take that for granted. Not like they would straight-up rejoice and whatnot. Most of them, anyway. The grieving period varies wildly.

name: noooo_oo_oo
text: Then again, I probably shouldn't leave the TV on while I internet. Especially when those judge shows come on i.e. Divorce Court...

name: thegoblins
text: Man, I'd probably grieve for years and years if I was a widder.  Different people react to different things different ways.  Now now. Emotions.

name: jeffspaulding
text: My wife says the same thing. But tax-free insurance money is a sure way to assuage any emotional pain. My wife is not insured, so I will truly grieve.

name: belgand
text: Getting life insurance seems like a great way to cause people to see your death as a way to benefit themselves. Yet it also provides no benefit to me. I'm amazed they can actually convince people to pay for it.

name: wozzeck
text: Not every man is pathologically self-asorbed, son.

name: belgand
text: Perhaps not, but it still seems like a poor idea to give people a financial incentive to have you dead. This is not exactly a new scheme.

name: featurelessvoid
text: Life insurance doesn't incent your loved ones to see you dead.  It simply neutralizes their burning financial incentive to have you keep living.  Think of it as an antacid tablet the whole family can enjoy.

name: belgand
text:
Double Indemnity and, well, a hell of a lot of other noir disagree with you most strongly.

Belgand's girlfriend is also forbidden from wearing anklets for this same reason.

name: hamscout
text: "Oh, did that slip down there again?

name: smallblackdog
text: it does mine, or so they tell me.

name: comrade_tom
text: Sit 'eeself down lad, today's the day your old man tells you about consideration for others.

name: aelindil
text:
I always feel like life insurance is a brilliant thing for a grieving other. I mean, one of my close friends died recently, and I wish there'd been something in place so that I could have just shut myself in and friggin' grieved properly without having to worry about bills and such. If it'd been my husband, there isn't any kind of way I'd be doing much in the way of self-supporting during such time as I'd be busy busting out in tears at seemingly random moments.

So yeah, I don't think it'd really help in that way, other than not adding a financial burden on top of the actual sadness.

[disclaimer] I don't actually think about this on a regular basis, but it's been a really fucking heavy summer for me.

name: thegoblins
text: I sorry :(

name: mensch
text:
Emotion! Empathy! Concern!

This is why chicks on the internet should be restricted to porn objects.

name: thegoblins
text:
I empathize so hard sometimes I cry with them and BLOOD COMES OUT. Best not be stepping to me, I will show you womanly tenderness, motherfucker.

On a semi-related note, apparently Myers-Briggs thinks I am like Jesus.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: I was genuinely torn between giving this comment a chubby and a lame. I want to chulame you. I've given a chubby, but you should imagine that I handed it to you on the end of a stick, through a small iron grating in a heavy oak door.

name: thegoblins
text: I giggled.  I like to be a dick for comedy purposes too.

name: aelindil
text: Thanks.  Things just tend to Happen, you know.

name: thegoblins
text: Yep.  Anytime.  And by "anytime" I mean "a futile expression of vague sympathy anytime."

name: hedonismbot
text:
It was even worse in the days (the days are still here for many families) when women stayed home to care for children. When the old man died, there was no income. They would go on stamps. Little children, no shoes. Just because papa bear got heart problems. 300K properly invested can make a pretty passable life for someone in that situation. A policy that covers that much isn't too hard to get.

Of course, in situations where you have double-income, no kids (DINKs), life insurance is a dumb idea. You would be far better off just using the money outright

name: edd36
text: Slightly off on a tangent but: thegoblins you're avatar change seems to have bought out the worst in me. Before I saw a witty, inteligent, pretty woman. Now all I see is pussy.

name: anticitizen
text: *your

name: anticitizen
text: sorry dude, you know we're cool.  i'm just a grammar fag.

name: belgand
text: I'm sure glad I'm not a colon right now.

name: mensch
text: Chubby for wittiest comment of the day!

name: thegoblins
text: It's just that I've become a bit kitten-obsessed lately.  My friends have this little fluffball who lost her mother at two weeks (she's now five or six weeks older).  She's the cutest thing.  I run my finger over her back and she closes her eyes and PURRS.  I offer her a bottle of kitty formula and she goes APESHIT, all grabbing at it with her paws, wide-eyed and scrabbling, mewling piteously whenever I take it away.  I just...I love that cat, okay.  Don't judge me.

name: thegoblins
text: *five or six weeks old, not older

name: mr-siegal
text: Just don't let her go to a palm reader!

name: thegoblins
text: Nieeuuuuuuuwwww!

name: thegoblins
text: Also, thanks for the oblique/ slightly creepy compliment.

name: happyidiot
text: change of topic here. you're a girl, maybe you can help with this. ya know how some girls clap. you can catch a bit of it in this video.. some chick in the audience. the hands all cupped in some unnatural Cartilage Hand sort of way. all slow and measured and just... just evocative of the entire image of restrained propriety. yeah guys do it too, but girls seem to do it so much more often. it's so much more visual with girls, it's a single element of an entire body language of a culture that idolizes gender roles and Hannah Montana and Pat Robertson. What's up with that?

name: mr-siegal
text: She's mesmerised, whether by his monotone delivery or Harpo hair, is uncertain.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: I'm fascinated by one aspect of body language: when, in a play or due to drag-king related hi-jinks, a woman tries to act like a man, one thing she always does is put her hands on her hips. However, in reality that is a far more common gesture for women (like walking with arms crossed, though I think that may be something to do with breasts). Where did women get the collective idea that hands on hips is a masculine gesture. Did they learn it in PSE?

name: mr-siegal
text:
Males standing hands on hips was much more common in 19th and early 20th centuries (I speak from a anglo-centric perspective.) This, and arms crossed, was often a statement of resistance as in a picket line.

There may be an evolutionary element since folded arms make the upper body appear larger and arms akimbo makes the whole torso appear larger.

For women it may be more a statement of assertiveness than aping a man, but I agree there is often a breast issue. I know if half the population spent most of their time looking at my chest I'd be looking for cover too.

name: mr-siegal
text:
Further to our discussion

http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua5nZ24W

name: thegoblins
text: Yeah, I'd agree that it's the whole thing of taking up more space.  When I cross my arms across my chest, sometimes it's because I'm being overly conscious of my breasts.  Sometimes I just want to knwo that they're still there.

name: thegoblins
text:
See, I can't help you here, because I'd personally be having a grand mal seizure right there in the aisles.

But anyway, the answer is very simple: girls don't want to look like spazzes. Guys just don't care.

name: stonecrab
text: Husbands either - even if they could pay off the house with your life insurance. It seems that spouses usually take this sort of thing personally.

name: nagash
text:
It's pretty sad when you're comparing yourself to a burdensome car loan.

Also, first post! (that I have ever made on assetbar)

name: clmalone84
text: Beef, you silly bastard...everyone knows cats have nine lives! By my count, you've still got to suffer the agony death five more times! That's nothing like paying off the car loan...more like trying to pay off the student loan, and the bank keeps on calling you even though your payments are on time, just to offer you products...

name: hatstand_mcq
text: Beef died several times in his youth. He never told anyone, although one time he missed most of double maths.

name: cracklewater
text:
I just realised - every one of Achewood's characters who has gone to the afterlife and come back is a cat - Beef, Ray, Molly (and family), Charley.
No-No looked like some kind of cat, and Trouble Man might have been one (not that these two seem to have left the afterlife).

Just a coincidence, or is it only cats that have the ability to recorporate, due to their multiple lives?

Possibly a moot point in this case, as Beef is being Hastened off to the queue of Samsara.

Also, vinegar and brown paper are a folk-lore remedy for a broken crown. Not sure if this has any relation to vinegar and white A4 being used to Hasten...

name: mawk
text: Todd.

name: lateadopter
text: You forgot Todd, and maybe another squirrel or two.

name: honesttom
text: And Teodor, briefly.

name: mawk
text:
Teodor was a special case, simply because he sucks so hard at being a ghost.

so hard.

name: cracklewater
text:
Teodor didn't die all the way, but I am ashamed to have forgotten Todd.

Maybe I should slip him a ten...

name: wingspan
text: A4? That's unamerican. Also, CH doesn't really seem like an ISO kind of guy to me.

name: cracklewater
text: But he does seem American to you?

name: aelindil
text:
Well, stuffed animals don't really die, as they can't fully be considered living.

Even if they're five.

name: jeffspaulding
text: Stuffed animals never die, they just fray away.

text:
Welcome to our company official website
The Yurdish Group is fruit's importer and exporter
in Middle East, Asia, Europe and Turkey since 1997

text: Chubbied for hilarity. (The hilarity is doubled because this is an actual quote .)

name: thegoblins
text: I am fruit's nemesis.

name: belgand

name: thegoblins
text:
PINNOCHIO!

Oh wait...

name: i_love_kate
text: You keeled my father. Prepare to die.

name: belgand
text: That steak you just ate was my uncle. I think we have more in common than you realize.

name: troy_convers
text: Is that vinegar and brown paper that Cartilage Head is preparing? Is there a Jack & Jill subplot I'm not aware of?

name: plummet
text:
The vinegar is there to destroy Roast Beef's already highly symptomatic, acidic stomach

The paper will poison his body after it leaks out of the holes in his stomach

name: wingspan
text: You are the only person other than my own mother I've ever seen make reference to the vinegar and brown paper aspect of the Jack & Jill saga.

name: thegoblins
text: An elderly female relative taught me this: Jack and Jill went up the hill to fetch a pail of water/ Goodness knows what they did, they came back with a daughter. I love my family.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Old females cannot be trusted.  Has assetbar taught you nothing?

name: thegoblins
text: This one doesn't have an annoying gray box hovering over her head providing her age, sex, some pseudo-witty status, and a disconcerting double image of her face.

name: belgand
text:
At present you don't even have a double image. When I mouse over I get a picture of a kitten. Not quite the same.

Unless, that is, you're secretly a kitten and have been fooling us all along in which case I say "Good show!"

name: shelbydavis
text: On the Internet, no one knows you're a kitten.

name: wingspan
text: A lot of old females have a gray box.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Is that your Creation Myth?

Did Mom and Dad ever point at a hill to you and say, "It was that hill, dear." ?

name: aelindil
text: Armchair psychology, courtesy of assetbar.

name: thegoblins
text: No, actually, they just told me I was born a chewed-up wad of vinegar and brown paper, dripping in pus and mucus and blood.

name: spectre
text: But you got better . . . well, some better.

name: thegoblins
text: Eh it could be worse.

name: wingspan
text: Your nose could be gushing blood.

name: greyfield
text: Cartilage Head didn't need to bring the full piece of paper just to remove a few shreds, but he needs an excuse for throwing it away to get rid of his surplus.

name: machineelf
text: Cartilage Head is left handed. All the great people are, really.

never seen 'em in the same place at the same time, I'm just saying.

You gotta have faith.
just not the Jewish faith?

We also would have accepted:

Wake me up before you gulag.

name: desert_donkey
text: hitler seemed a bit more moody/angsty. like, if he'd got caught whackin' off in a public bathroom, it doesn't seem like he'd go out and make a music video parody of the whole thing.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: Hitler would cobble together some terrible excuse, and stick to it religiously. If anyone ever bought it up, even in a really jokey affectionate way, he'd throw a huge paddy, and storm out of the restaurant or pub. Someone would have to go after him, to persuade him not to walk the six miles home through the rain.

name: troy_convers
text: He's also been caught slumped over the wheel of his staff car, photographed apparently sleeping at traffic lights in Berlin. He awoke after someone knocked on his window for five minutes, and was "sweating heavily and had his iPod on". He drove away weaving, and then hit a traffic bollard. Later the same month, he was questioned by police after colliding with three cars in the strasse in which he lives.

name: desert_donkey
text: heh

name: aperson

name: aperson
text: cartilageanous

name: comrade_tom

text:
*Delenda.

apologies.

name: thegoblins
text: "Coughed various types of epithelia up on me. Smelled like something organic undergoing a transformation, dreams into coruscating visions, cobwebs creeping upon my soul...will not be engaging in surreal and erotic acts with this inexplicable being again."

I made this account for no other purpose than to chubby this.

BRAVO.

name: divot
text: From the title of this comic in my email I thought Beef was about to get saved by the cat who can use a toilet.

name: mtrott
text:
I am continually impressed (I'm not sure that is the appropriate word) by how accurately Onstad can convey the thought processes of debilitating clinical depression.
Although, I thought Beef had been doing so well! Can't blame the dude for sadding hard at this sudden ostensible demise.

name: machineelf
text:
I love that trippy wallpaper background. Upon closer inspection, however, I realize that it is the exact same background in frames 1-5 and 8. Probably Onstad was lazy, as the background does change in the two previous strips in which we see it. But a more interesting idea is that Cartilage Head has magic, perspective-changing wallpaper. It's like one of those paintings where the eyes follow you, only it's a crazy-ass wallpaper.

In conclusion, I want one of those.

name: aperson
text: A few posts ago I said I thought C.H. was somehow trying to be helpful. I take that back.

name: camidumas
text: CH is an artist.  Artists tend to be self-centered and unhelpful.

name: jeffspaulding
text: Gee, I guess I'm an artist too.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: Last night I was such an artist that now there is broken glass all over the lawn.

name: sbernard81
text:
The fluid that perpetually seeps out of Cartilage Head's eye sockets is...

a. Blood and pus; as a consequence of CH's condition, his eye sockets are essentially open wounds.

OR,

b. Tears; as a consequence of CH's condition, he is in a perpetual state of agony and cannot stop crying.

text:
c. tears, he constantly seeps tears from his tear ducts that were damaged when he was shot stopping a truck hijacking that involved David Caruso.

Whaaaaaaooooooooooooooo!

Cartilage Head weeps for Roast Beef, and subsequently, for the world.

Jesus, I keep wanting to type Pyramid Head. That is the last thing that needs to be associated with this arc.

name: shelbydavis
text: But he failed First Aid after he took the boy pretending to have a compound fracture and gently wrapped first the arm, and then the entire body in a tattered shroud.

name: mawk
text: when the bemused instructor removed the shroud from the boy, she found that where the boy had once stood there was an ornate wrought-iron coatstand. hanging alone on the coatstand was a tattered and faded bowler hat, weeping softly from within its concave depths.

name: thegoblins
text: I really don't like what's going on in the last panel.  It's like the pillow is so in love with Roast Beef that it is content to be lying there with him, which is nice, but it's completely oblivious to Beef's state of despair.  If that's love, lock me up in a convent.

name: anticitizen
text: GET THEE TO A NUNNERY!

name: belgand
text: I can't stop thinking about School of the Holy Beast now. But I don't think that's exactly the sort of love that The Goblins is looking for.

name: comrade_tom
text: WHY WOULD'ST THOU BE A BREEDER OF SINNERS?

name: cygnusx-1
text: Am I the only one that interpreted "use your death" as some way of saying Beef's not going to die? That CH is going to use the powers of death to somehow do something insane that I thought of because I'm pretty baked while writing this.

name: choco
text: I think you are on to something. I was just looking at this strip thinking that it doesn't make sense that it could be so simple as CH killing the cat. Where's the interest in it? CH is up to something more... is it selfish? Is it selfless? I have no idea as of yet. I will probably be the last to know.

name: happyidiot
text:
I predict that CH is going to hold Roast Beef's hands and drink the confetti. CH's body being made of cartilage, perhaps it is malleable such that his hands can 'take on' the lash of thanatos simply by being pressed against Beef's hands.

Beef awakes mysteriously in his own bed the next morning, thinking he's dead, until he finds a note in his shirt pocket from CH and finally figures out what happened, and figures out that Teodor and Ray are in hospital, having been rescued by the 5-0. Somehow or other they figure out that the pamphlet which contains the key to Beef's long-term viability is what rearranged Ray's noggin, and there ensues a hilarious Seinfeld-like wild goose chase to find it. Agents of the SUV maker have hauled away the SUV in a bid to cover up any possible evidence of a mechanical or design defect in the beast, and it all climaxes in a car chase with a van and Mr. T. and Airwolf and they get there just in time to shut off the crusher which has already partly crushed the SUV. They retrieve the CH pamphlet from the half-crushed SUV, and it's doused in week-old sauce that burst forth from KFC honey mustard packets, and then our comrades have a hearty laugh as Todd tumbles out of the glove box covered in honey mustard and his own vomit, wearing a tactical vest stuffed with mini pipe bombs, drunkenly brandishing a Todd-size samurai sword and screaming angrily at everyone "WHATCHULOOKINGATWILLS!" as the frame freezes in an ending reminiscent of Francois Truffaut's Les Quatre Cents Coups.

name: c_dizzle
text:
1) How dare you taint Achewood by referencing Seinfeld.

2) Unless you give an illustration to compliment your anticipatory fanfic, methinks you should let Onstad finish the story he started...because yours is booooriiiing.

name: comrade_tom
text: I agree, Let the man work!

name: happyidiot
text: sorry for partying!

name: mawk
text: there is nothing up the man's sleeves, and yet with one swift sweeping motion the Spectre of Death is become a bouquet of flowers! oh, what whimsy!

name: octafish
text: Again? That trick never works.

name: comrade_tom
text:
Dude, Don't go on the internet when you're high, nothing good ever came of that. Read a book or walk round a forest instead.

and don't come crying to us when two days later you realise you outbid everyone on Ebay for some glasswear with pictures of Roger Ebert on it.

name: anticitizen
text:
When I was about twelve or so, I remember a friend of mine stopping by my house to say hi, stoned out of his proverbial gourd. He was only there for about three minutes before he decided he just HAD to go shopping.

He came back the next day, furious, with two big shopping bags under his arms. "Dude, what's in the-"

But he'd already emptied them out onto the floor. There was a good $120 worth of "WORLD'S GREATEST GRANDMOTHER" apparel and merchandise.

"FUCK. YOU. DUDE." and he stormed off.

name: stereo
text: You were a grandmother at 12?  Good lord.

name: mensch
text: I hate it when I forget to tell my wife I am dying.

name: mawk
text: I often find it hard to fall asleep because of Doubts; did I leave the stovetop on? is the front door locked? did I forget to tell my wife I am dying tonight?

In the middle of winter I took my nice warm boots off to paddle in the sea because the moon was soooo bright it had to be warm, you know? To avoid freezing to death I spent the rest of the night playing Mario Kart(N64) and listening to a bootleg recording of Smile.

name: featurelessvoid
text:
gladi8orrex Quote:
i did elote o finkinlin' ove teh weekend, was ma berf day (i did cry. and the only time someone sang happy birthday 2 me was when i did it for myself, tears streamin' don ma face sitting on my heels in the corner of the bathroom in the basement.) an' i m not like h8r's, 1: an i guezz dat wat am do is i donno wot.


Translation:

I did elope to Finland over the weekend. It was my best day. I did it! Crazy! After the lonely times, someone even sang happy birthday to me. It was wonderful, if I do say so myself.

Tires screamin' during the motor race, second [second-place contestant] on my heels in the corner. Off the brakes, zoom in the best manner.

And I'm hot like heaters. And I guess that what I aim to do is eat donuts. Woot.

Commentary:

Glad decided it was time to live life to the fullest. He moved to Finland, got married, and became a race car driver, all in the same weekend. And that was only the beginning. After winning the big race, he ate a whole donut, with a candle on top to celebrate his birthday. Bavarian cream, people. Bavarian. Freaking. Cream. Because that's how Glad rolls.
